commit_list.message:
Allow filters in assign.

A simple attempt, but basically it shifts the parsing of the right hand side of the assign from a simple context lookup to using the Variable parser (that includes filters). Fixes #79.

Add a sleep timeout

Running at 100% causes it to overload the CPUs unnecessarily; added a
sleep timer to prevent it from running too much; defaults to 1ms sleep
time (1000hz).

commit_list.message:
Allow ARM and X64 Builds

When building DLLs, LINK.exe requires a /MACHINE option. This enables x64 builds by using the Platform ENV set in the VS Tool's 'x64 Command Prompt' to determine which machine to link for.

commit_list.message: Fallback login for those without a login

MessageController Organization

Move all message related stuff into it's own controller because it's getting unweidly.
Preload the users since there's a huge chance it will be needed on the load

Optimization Instrumentation

Basically, this lets me see what part was balooning the render time. Ultimately I found that it was the constant reloading of database elements. Fixing it now is premature optimization but it's good to know where the loadtime was.
Fix case sensitivity and extended chars
Add Ruby encoding and remove unneeded comments
Only mods and admins can edit or delete messages
Add a body_original to the liquid so as to see what the original was when editing

Super Sanitize

This adds sanitization to the user HTML so that it prevents XSS, bad CSS, and other nastyness. The sanitize gem is amazing by making a great sanitizer!

It also added a custom transform for the text. It basically enforces that all first level tags are p, blockquote, or pre tags, with no floating text. This means that the theme developer can safely assume that the body will have those block tags as the first level tags, regardless of user input.

This also means that user input is pretty flexible. A user can just input raw text and it will paragraph or line break out fine. A user could also enter good HTML paragraphs, and be mostly unscathed (except for sanitization).
Lock the admin pages to admins only
Try moderatorships so if the user is nil it still works
Heorku wants the secrets file to work

Create Permissions

Forums now have a 'who can create topic?' and 'who can reply?' permission attached to them.
